1.t: There was certainly a time when there was no mention of the human being.
1.tr: Hal ataa 'alal insaani heenum minad dahri lam yakun shai'am mazkooraa

2.t: We created the human being from the union of sperm and egg to test him. We gave him hearing and vision.
2.tr: Innaa khalaqnal insaana min nutfatin amshaajin nabta-leehi faja'alnaahu samee'am baseeraa

3.t: We showed him the right path whether he would be grateful or ungrateful.
3.tr: Innaa hadainaahus sabeela immaa shaakiranw Wa-immaa kafoora

4.t: We have prepared chains, shackles, and flaming fire (for the disbelievers).
4.tr: Innaaa a'tadnaa lilkaa-fireena salaasila Wa-aghlaalanw Wa-sa'eeraa

5.t: The virtuous ones will drink from a cup containing camphor
5.tr: Innal abraara yashra-boona min kaasin kaana mizaa-juhaa kaafooraa

6.t: which flows from a spring from which the servants of God will drink.
6.tr: Aynany yashrabu bihaa 'ibaadul laahi yufajjiroonahaa tafjeeraa

7.t: The servants of God fulfill their vows and are afraid of the day in which there will be widespread terror.
7.tr: Yoofoona binnazri Wa-yakhaafoona yawman kaana sharruhoo mustateeraa

8.t: They feed the destitute, orphans, and captives for the love of God, saying,
8.tr: Wa-yut'imoonat ta'aama 'alaa hubbihee miskeenanw Wa-yateemanw Wa-aseeraa

9.t: "We only feed you for the sake of God and we do not want any reward or thanks from you.
9.tr: Innaamaa nut'imukum li-wajhil laahi laa nureedu minkum jazaaa'anw Wa-laa shukooraa

10.t: We are afraid of our Lord and the bitterly distressful day".
10.tr: Innaa nakhaafu mir Rabbinna Yawman 'aboosan qamtareeraa

11.t: God will certainly rescue them from the terror of that day and will meet them with joy and pleasure.
11.tr: Fa-waqaahumul laahu sharra zaalikal yawmi Wa-laqqaahum nadratanw Wa-surooraa

12.t: For their patience, He will reward them with Paradise and silk.

13.t: They will recline therein on couches and they will find neither excessive heat nor cold.
13.tr: Muttaki'eena feeha 'alal araaa-'iki laa yarawna feehaa shamsanw Wa-laa zamhareeraa

14.t: The shades of the garden will be closely spread over them and it will be easy for them to reach the fruits.

15.t: They will be served with silver dishes and crystal clear goblets.
15.tr: Wa-yutaafu 'alaihim bi-aaniyatim min fiddatinw Wa-akwaabin kaanat qawaareeraa

16.t: Also there will be crystal clear goblets of silver containing the exact measure of drink which they desire.

17.t: They will drink cups containing (soft flowing) sparkling water
17.tr: Wa-yuskawna feehaa kaasan kaana mizaajuhaa zanjabeelaa

19.t: They will be served by immortal youths who look like scattered pearls.
19.tr: Wa-yatoofu 'alaihim wildaanum mukhalladoona izaa ra-aytahum hasibtahum lu'lu-'am mansoora

20.t: If you were to see it, you would find it to be a great kingdom with great bounty.
20.tr: Wa-izaa ra-ayta samma ra-ayta na'eemanw Wa-mulkan kabeera

21.t: They will have fine green silk and brocade, and they will be decked with bracelets of silver. Their Lord will provide them with a drink of pure wine.
21.tr: Aaliyahum siyaabu sundusin khudrunw Wa-istabraq, Wa-hullooo asaawira min fiddatinw Wa-saqaahum Rabbuhum sharaaban tahooraa

22.t: This will be their reward and their efforts will be appreciated.
22.tr: Innaa haazaa kaana lakum jazz-'anw Wa-kaana sa'yukum mashkooraa

23.t: (Muhammad), We have revealed the Quran to you in gradual steps.

24.t: So wait patiently for the command of your Lord and do not yield to any sinful or disbelieving person among them (people).
24.tr: Fasbir lihukmi Rabbika Wa-laa tuti' minhum aasiman aw kafooraa

25.t: Mention the Name of your Lord, mornings and evenings.

26.t: Prostrate before Him and glorify Him extensively during the night.
26.tr: Wa-minal laili fasjud lahoo Wa-sabbihhu lailan taweelaa

27.t: These people (disbelievers) love the worldly life and neglect the terrifying day which will come.
27.tr: Inna haaa'ulaa'i yuhibboona 'aajilata Wa-yazaroona waraaa'ahum yawman saqeelaa

28.t: We have created them and have given them strength. Had We wanted, We could have replaced them with another people like them.
28.tr: Nahnu khalaqnaahum Wa-shadadnaaa asrahum Wa-izaa shi'naa baddalnaaa amsaala-hum tabdeelaa

29.t: This chapter is a reminder. Let those who want, seek guidance from their Lord.
29.tr: Inna haazihee tazkiratun fa-man shaaa'at takhaza ilaa rabbihee sabeela

30.t: (The virtuous mentioned in this chapter) want only what God wants. God is All-knowing and All-wise.
30.tr: Wa-maa tashaaa'oona illaa any yashaaa'al laah; innal laahaa kaana 'Aleeman Hakeema

31.t: He admits to His mercy whomever He wants. For the unjust He has prepared a painful punishment.
31.tr: Yudkhilu mai yashaaa'u fee rahmatih; wazzaalimeena a'adda lahum 'azaaban aleemaa
